TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit PrintingPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: Controls access to printers. This class cannot be inherited.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermissionLevel printingLevel) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the level of printing access specified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with either fully restricted or unrestricted access, as specified.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor creates either the fully restricted (`None`) or the `Unrestricted` form of the permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission object.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A copy of the permission object represents the same access to resources as the original permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void FromXml(class System.Security.SecurityElement esd) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
Docs.summary: Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission object of the same type as the current permission object.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission object and a target permission object.
Docs.returns: A new permission object that represents the intersection of the current object and the specified target. This object is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both hold in common. Specifically, it represents the minimum permissions required for a demand to pass both permissions.

Docs.exception: is an object that is not of the same type as the current permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission object that is to be tested for the subset relationship. This object must be of the same type as the current permission object.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission object is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission object is a subset of ; otherwise, .
Docs.exception: is an object that is not of the same type as the current permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the permission is unrestricted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An unrestricted permission object represents access to any and all resources protected by the permission.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the code's level of printing access.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
Docs.returns: An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission object of the same type as the current permission object.
Docs.summary: Creates a permission that combines the permission object and the target permission object.
Docs.returns: A new permission object that represents the union of the current permission object and the specified permission object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The result of a call to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.UIPermission.Union%2A> is a permission that represents all the operations represented by the current permission object, and all the operations represented by the specified permission object.

Docs.exception: is an object that is not of the same type as the current permission object.
